hero.title: Your Personalized Mid-Level Full-Stack Engineer Roadmap is Ready!

radarAxes.label: Frontend
radarAxes.title: Frontend Development
radarAxes.description: Advanced React, TypeScript, Next.js, and modern frontend frameworks. Build scalable UIs.

radarAxes.label: Backend
radarAxes.title: Backend Development
radarAxes.description: Node.js, microservices, GraphQL, and API design. Build robust backend systems.

radarAxes.label: System Design
radarAxes.title: System Design & Architecture
radarAxes.description: Scalability, caching, distributed systems, and architectural patterns for production systems.

radarAxes.label: Databases
radarAxes.title: Database Management
radarAxes.description: Advanced SQL, NoSQL, database design, optimization, and data modeling.

radarAxes.label: DevOps
radarAxes.title: DevOps & Cloud
radarAxes.description: Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).

easy: Strengthen your full-stack fundamentals - React + Node.js
Build 1-2 end-to-end projects demonstrating full-stack skills
Practice system design basics and microservices concepts
doable: Master TypeScript across frontend and backend
Build production-ready full-stack applications with proper architecture
Learn Docker basics and cloud deployment (AWS/Azure)
challenging: Deep dive into microservices and distributed systems
Master system design patterns for scalable applications
Build complex projects with real-time features and proper DevOps
stretch: Plan for 4-6 months of focused preparation on advanced topics
Master system design, Kubernetes, and production-grade architecture
Consider gaining more hands-on experience with large-scale systems

rounds.name: Online Assessment
points: 2-3 full-stack coding problems covering frontend and backend logic
Common topics: API design, data transformation, React components, async operations
May include questions on TypeScript, Node.js, and database queries
Time management is key - aim to complete all problems efficiently

rounds.name: Machine Coding Round (Full-Stack)
points: Build a complete full-stack feature (e.g., user authentication, CRUD API with UI)
Demonstrate both frontend (React) and backend (Node.js/Express) skills
Focus on clean code, proper API design, and database integration
Working functionality with good architecture matters most

rounds.name: Technical Interview (Backend/System Design)
points: Design a scalable backend system (e.g., URL shortener, notification service)
Discuss microservices, caching strategies, database choices, and API design
May include coding questions on Node.js, async patterns, and data structures
Explain trade-offs and discuss how to handle scale and failures

rounds.name: Technical Interview (Full-Stack)
points: Deep dive into full-stack architecture and your past projects
Questions on React/Next.js, state management, and frontend optimization
Backend topics: REST vs GraphQL, authentication, database design
Live coding: build a small feature end-to-end and explain your choices

rounds.name: Hiring Manager / Cultural Fit
points: Discussion about end-to-end ownership of features and projects
Behavioral questions on handling technical debt, mentoring, and collaboration
Why this company and role? Show genuine interest in product and tech
Ask thoughtful questions about team structure, tech stack, and growth

easy: Master full-stack fundamentals - TypeScript, React, Node.js
Build 2-3 production-grade full-stack projects with deployment
Practice system design basics and microservices architecture
doable: Strong full-stack skills are essential - master MERN/MEAN stack
Build scalable applications with proper architecture and testing
Learn Docker, AWS basics, and CI/CD pipelines
challenging: Deep understanding of system design and distributed systems
Master microservices, GraphQL, and real-time communication
Referrals significantly improve your chances - start networking
stretch: This requires 5-8 months of focused preparation
System design and production experience are critical at this level
Consider building more hands-on experience before targeting unicorns

rounds.name: Online Assessment
points: 3-4 coding problems ranging from easy to medium difficulty
Focus on JavaScript problem-solving and algorithmic thinking
May include frontend-specific challenges (DOM manipulation, async operations)
Passing score typically 60-70% to proceed to interviews

rounds.name: DSA Round 1
points: 1-2 medium problems on arrays, strings, or hash maps
Expected to arrive at optimal solution with hints
Code on shared editors like CoderPad or HackerRank
Interviewer evaluates problem-solving approach and communication

rounds.name: DSA Round 2 / Frontend Fundamentals
points: Could be another DSA round or deep dive into JavaScript internals
Topics: closures, prototypes, event loop, promises, this keyword
Questions on React: virtual DOM, reconciliation, hooks, performance
Write code to demonstrate concepts (e.g., implement Promise.all)

rounds.name: Machine Coding / UI Round
points: Build a real-world component: search with autocomplete, pagination, filters
Use React or vanilla JavaScript based on company preference
Focus on code organization, reusability, and edge case handling
Bonus points for responsive design and accessibility considerations

rounds.name: Hiring Manager / Bar Raiser
points: Behavioral questions using STAR format (Situation, Task, Action, Result)
Deep dive into your best project - technical decisions and trade-offs
Questions about handling challenges, tight deadlines, and collaboration
Culture fit assessment - research company values beforehand

easy: Solid full-stack fundamentals - React, Node.js, databases
Build 1-2 full-stack projects demonstrating CRUD operations
Prepare clear explanations of your architecture and technical decisions
doable: Strengthen your full-stack skills - TypeScript, Express, MongoDB/PostgreSQL
Learn Docker and basic cloud deployment concepts
Practice common full-stack interview questions and system design basics
challenging: Deep understanding of full-stack architecture and best practices
Build portfolio projects with proper testing and deployment
Focus on communication and explaining technical trade-offs clearly
stretch: Service companies value steady growth and learning ability
Focus on fundamentals and demonstrating hands-on experience
This should be achievable with 3-4 months of focused preparation

rounds.name: Aptitude & Online Test
points: Quantitative aptitude, logical reasoning, and verbal ability
1-2 easy coding problems (basic loops, conditionals, arrays)
MCQs on HTML, CSS, JavaScript basics
Focus on accuracy over speed - cutoff-based filtering

rounds.name: Technical Interview 1
points: Questions on HTML tags, CSS selectors, and JavaScript syntax
Explain concepts: var vs let vs const, event delegation, box model
Simple coding: reverse a string, find duplicates in array
Project discussion - be ready to explain your contributions clearly

rounds.name: Technical Interview 2
points: Deeper dive into JavaScript: closures, hoisting, callbacks
Basic React questions if it's on your resume: JSX, props, state
May ask to build a simple layout or debug existing code
Focus on fundamentals - breadth over depth

rounds.name: HR Interview
points: Standard questions: strengths, weaknesses, why this company
Career goals and willingness to learn new technologies
Salary expectations (be realistic for fresher roles)
Relocation flexibility and notice period discussion

easy: Master full-stack architecture - React, Node.js, TypeScript, databases
Prepare for full-stack system design discussions
Practice behavioral interviews with STAR format
doable: Strong DSA and system design skills are critical - solve 100+ problems
Master full-stack development with microservices and cloud platforms
Build impressive portfolio projects demonstrating scale and complexity
challenging: DSA and system design mastery are mandatory - aim for 150+ problems
Deep full-stack system design and distributed systems knowledge required
Strong referrals are almost essential - network actively with employees
stretch: This is the highest bar - plan for 8-12 months of intense preparation
Expert-level system design and production experience highly valued
Consider building 1-2 more years of experience before targeting FAANG

rounds.name: Recruiter Screen
points: Initial call to verify your background and interest
Overview of the interview process and timeline
Questions about visa status, location preferences, start date
Opportunity to ask about the team and role expectations

rounds.name: Phone/Online Technical Screen
points: 1-2 coding problems on shared editor (CoderPad, Google Docs)
Medium difficulty - arrays, strings, hash maps, or trees
Focus on clean code, edge cases, and optimal time complexity
Strong communication is essential - think out loud throughout

rounds.name: Onsite: Coding Round 1
points: Medium to hard DSA problem with live whiteboard or code editor
Common topics: dynamic programming, trees, graphs, recursion
Interviewer evaluates problem breakdown and optimization
Expect follow-up questions to extend or modify your solution

rounds.name: Onsite: Coding Round 2
points: Another DSA problem, potentially harder or different domain
May involve advanced data structures or complex logic
Write clean, bug-free code under time pressure
Discuss multiple approaches before settling on implementation

rounds.name: Onsite: Frontend System Design
points: Design a frontend system: autocomplete, infinite scroll, feed
Cover component architecture, state management, API design
Discuss performance: lazy loading, code splitting, caching
Address accessibility, error handling, and edge cases

rounds.name: Onsite: Behavioral / Googleyness
points: Amazon: Leadership Principles with STAR format
Google: Googleyness - collaboration, growth mindset, adaptability
Prepare stories about ownership, conflict, learning from failure
Questions like 'Tell me about a time you had to learn something new quickly'

rounds.name: Hiring Committee & Team Match
points: Google: Packet reviewed by hiring committee for final decision
Amazon: Bar raiser provides independent assessment
Team matching calls to find mutual fit
Process can take 2-4 weeks post-onsite

phases.title: Advanced Full-Stack Patterns

whatYouLearn.title: TypeScript Mastery
whatYouLearn.description: Advanced types, generics, decorators, and type-safe full-stack development

whatYouLearn.title: Advanced React & Next.js
whatYouLearn.description: Server components, SSR/SSG, performance optimization, advanced hooks patterns

whatYouLearn.title: Node.js & Microservices
whatYouLearn.description: Express/Fastify, microservices architecture, message queues, and event-driven design

phases.target: Build production-grade full-stack applications with modern architecture
whyItMatters: Essential skills for mid-level full-stack roles at top companies
Microservices are the industry standard for scalable applications
TypeScript is the most in-demand skill for full-stack developers in 2024

phases.title: System Design & Architecture

whatYouLearn.title: Distributed Systems Fundamentals
whatYouLearn.description: CAP theorem, consistency patterns, database sharding, replication strategies

whatYouLearn.title: System Design Patterns
whatYouLearn.description: Load balancing, caching strategies (Redis), CDNs, rate limiting, circuit breakers

whatYouLearn.title: Scalability & Performance
whatYouLearn.description: Horizontal vs vertical scaling, database optimization, query performance, indexes

phases.target: Design scalable systems and ace system design interviews
whyItMatters: System design is critical for mid-level and senior roles at all companies
Top companies expect strong system design skills even at mid-level
Understanding architecture separates mid-level from senior engineers

phases.title: DevOps & Cloud Infrastructure

whatYouLearn.title: Docker & Containerization
whatYouLearn.description: Docker fundamentals, multi-stage builds, Docker Compose, container orchestration basics

whatYouLearn.title: CI/CD & Automation
whatYouLearn.description: GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, automated testing, deployment pipelines, infrastructure as code

whatYouLearn.title: Cloud Platforms (AWS/Azure/GCP)
whatYouLearn.description: EC2, S3, Lambda, RDS, load balancers, CDN, monitoring, and cost optimization

phases.target: Deploy and manage production applications on cloud platforms
whyItMatters: DevOps skills are increasingly expected from full-stack developers
Cloud platforms power 90% of modern applications
CI/CD and automation are standard practices at all product companies

phases.title: Technical Leadership & Ownership

whatYouLearn.title: Full-Stack System Design Interviews
whatYouLearn.description: Practice designing scalable systems, API design, database schema, and architecture discussions

whatYouLearn.title: Advanced Full-Stack Projects
whatYouLearn.description: Build 2-3 production-grade projects: SaaS platform, real-time app, microservices system

whatYouLearn.title: Technical Communication & Leadership
whatYouLearn.description: STAR format stories, ownership examples, mentoring experience, technical decision-making

phases.target: Demonstrate senior-level capabilities and land mid-to-senior roles
whyItMatters: Mid-level roles require demonstrating ownership and technical leadership
Portfolio projects with scale and complexity set you apart significantly
System design interviews are critical for mid-level full-stack positions

projects.title: Multi-Tenant SaaS Project Management Platform
projects.description: Build a production-grade SaaS platform with team workspaces, role-based access control, real-time updates, and subscription management
projects.shortDescription: Full-stack SaaS with multi-tenancy, authentication, and real-time features
projects.fullDescription: Create a comprehensive project management SaaS platform using Next.js for the frontend, Node.js/Express for the backend, PostgreSQL for data persistence, and Redis for caching. Implement multi-tenant architecture, JWT authentication, role-based authorization, real-time collaboration using WebSockets, and integrate Stripe for subscription management. This project demonstrates production-ready full-stack architecture, security best practices, and scalable design patterns.

implementationSteps.title: Setup Full-Stack Architecture
implementationSteps.description: Initialize Next.js 14+ with TypeScript for frontend. Setup Node.js/Express backend with TypeScript. Configure PostgreSQL database with Prisma ORM for schema management. Setup Redis for caching and session management. Create Docker Compose file for local development environment with all services.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Multi-Tenant Architecture & Auth
implementationSteps.description: Design database schema with workspace/organization tables for multi-tenancy. Implement JWT-based authentication with refresh tokens. Create middleware for tenant isolation - ensure users can only access data from their workspace. Build role-based access control (RBAC) with permissions: Owner, Admin, Member, Viewer. Hash passwords with bcrypt and validate inputs.

implementationSteps.title: Build Core Features & APIs
implementationSteps.description: Create RESTful APIs for projects, tasks, and team management using Express. Implement CRUD operations with proper validation using Zod/Joi. Build React components for project boards, task cards, and team dashboards. Use React Query for efficient data fetching and caching. Implement drag-and-drop for task management using dnd-kit library.

implementationSteps.title: Add Real-Time Collaboration
implementationSteps.description: Setup WebSocket server using Socket.io for real-time updates. Implement presence indicators showing who's online in each workspace. Broadcast task updates, comments, and assignments in real-time to all connected clients. Handle connection/reconnection logic gracefully. Use Redis pub/sub for scaling WebSocket across multiple servers.

implementationSteps.title: Integrate Stripe & Deploy
implementationSteps.description: Integrate Stripe for subscription management with 3 tiers: Free, Pro, Enterprise. Implement webhook handlers for subscription events (payment success/failure). Setup CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions for automated testing and deployment. Deploy frontend to Vercel and backend to AWS EC2/ECS with Docker. Configure PostgreSQL RDS and Redis ElastiCache. Setup monitoring with Datadog or New Relic.

projects.title: Real-Time Collaborative Whiteboard
projects.description: Build a real-time collaborative whiteboard with drawing tools, live cursors, presence indicators, and canvas persistence using WebSockets
projects.shortDescription: Real-time collaboration app with WebSockets and canvas API
projects.fullDescription: Create a production-quality collaborative whiteboard application where multiple users can draw, add shapes, text, and sticky notes in real-time. Use React/Next.js for the frontend, Node.js with Socket.io for real-time communication, and MongoDB for canvas persistence. Implement features like live cursor tracking, presence indicators, undo/redo functionality, room-based collaboration, and canvas export. This project demonstrates advanced WebSocket usage, canvas manipulation, real-time state synchronization, and building collaborative features.

implementationSteps.title: Setup Canvas & WebSocket Infrastructure
implementationSteps.description: Initialize Next.js project with TypeScript and Canvas API setup. Create Node.js/Express backend with Socket.io for WebSocket connections. Design database schema in MongoDB for storing canvas snapshots and rooms. Setup room-based architecture where each whiteboard session has a unique room ID. Implement connection/disconnection handlers and room join/leave events.

implementationSteps.title: Build Drawing Tools & Canvas Logic
implementationSteps.description: Implement canvas drawing with HTML5 Canvas API - support pencil, eraser, shapes (rectangle, circle, line), text, and sticky notes. Create a toolbar component with tool selection, color picker, and stroke width controls. Implement undo/redo functionality using command pattern - maintain a history stack of drawing actions. Handle touch events for mobile/tablet support alongside mouse events.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Real-Time Synchronization
implementationSteps.description: Broadcast drawing events to all users in the room using Socket.io. Implement efficient event throttling to avoid overwhelming the WebSocket connection (emit drawing points every 50ms). Synchronize canvas state for new users joining - send complete canvas snapshot. Handle conflict resolution when multiple users draw simultaneously using timestamps and last-write-wins strategy.

implementationSteps.title: Add Presence & Live Cursors
implementationSteps.description: Implement presence indicators showing all active users in the room with avatars/names. Track and display live cursor positions for all users with smooth interpolation. Show which user is currently drawing by highlighting their cursor. Add user color coding so each user's drawings have a distinct color. Implement typing indicators for text tool usage.

implementationSteps.title: Canvas Persistence & Export
implementationSteps.description: Auto-save canvas snapshots to MongoDB every 30 seconds or on significant changes. Implement canvas export functionality - allow users to download as PNG/SVG. Add version history - users can browse and restore previous canvas states. Deploy frontend to Vercel and backend to AWS EC2 with Docker. Use Redis for scaling Socket.io across multiple instances with sticky sessions. Setup monitoring and analytics for concurrent users and drawing events.

projects.title: Microservices-Based E-Commerce Platform
projects.description: Build a scalable e-commerce platform using microservices architecture with separate services for products, orders, payments, and notifications
projects.shortDescription: Microservices architecture with API gateway, message queues, and distributed system patterns
projects.fullDescription: Create a production-grade e-commerce platform using microservices architecture. Build separate services for Product Catalog, Order Management, Payment Processing, User Authentication, and Notifications. Use Node.js/Express for services, PostgreSQL for data persistence, Redis for caching, RabbitMQ/Kafka for async communication, and Docker/Kubernetes for orchestration. Implement API Gateway pattern, circuit breakers, service discovery, and distributed tracing. This advanced project demonstrates enterprise-level architecture, handling distributed systems challenges, and building for scale.

implementationSteps.title: Design Microservices Architecture
implementationSteps.description: Plan service boundaries: Product Service (catalog, inventory), Order Service (order management, cart), Payment Service (payment processing), User Service (authentication, profiles), Notification Service (emails, SMS). Design database schema for each service - use database-per-service pattern. Create API contracts and event schemas for inter-service communication. Document service dependencies and data flow diagrams.

implementationSteps.title: Setup Infrastructure & API Gateway
implementationSteps.description: Create Docker containers for each microservice with multi-stage builds. Setup Docker Compose for local development with all services, databases, Redis, and RabbitMQ. Implement API Gateway using Express Gateway or Kong to route requests to appropriate services. Configure service discovery and load balancing. Setup centralized logging with ELK stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana) and distributed tracing with Jaeger.

implementationSteps.title: Build Core Microservices
implementationSteps.description: Implement Product Service with PostgreSQL - CRUD APIs for products, inventory management, search with Elasticsearch. Build Order Service - create orders, manage cart, order status workflow. Implement User Service with JWT authentication and Redis for session management. Create Payment Service integrating with Stripe/Razorpay - handle payment webhooks and refunds. Each service should have its own database and expose RESTful APIs.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Async Communication
implementationSteps.description: Setup RabbitMQ or Kafka for event-driven communication between services. Implement event publishing: OrderCreated, PaymentProcessed, OrderShipped events. Build event consumers in each service to react to relevant events. Implement saga pattern for distributed transactions (e.g., order placement involving multiple services). Add retry logic and dead-letter queues for failed messages. Ensure idempotency for event handlers.

implementationSteps.title: Add Resilience & Deploy to Kubernetes
implementationSteps.description: Implement circuit breaker pattern using libraries like Opossum to prevent cascade failures. Add health check endpoints for each service. Implement rate limiting and request timeout handling. Create Kubernetes manifests (Deployments, Services, ConfigMaps, Secrets) for each microservice. Deploy to AWS EKS or GKE with auto-scaling configured. Setup CI/CD with GitHub Actions - automated testing, building Docker images, and deployment to Kubernetes. Configure monitoring with Prometheus and Grafana for metrics visualization.
